perturbation.original_text: Additional Reporting Person (a): Merck Serono SA Address: Zone Industrielle 1267 Coinsins, Switzerland Additional Reporting Person (b): Merck KGaA Address: Frankfurter Str. 250 64293 Darmstadt, Germany Designated Filer: Ares Trading SA Issuer and CUSIP: Intrexon Corporation (46122T102)
perturbation.changed_text: Additional Reporting Person (a): Merck Serono SA Address: Zone Industrielle 1267 Coinsins, Switzerland Additional Reporting Person (b): Merck KGaA Address: Frankfurter Str. 250 64293 Darmstadt, Germany Designated Filer: Ares Trading SA Issuer: Intrexon Corporation
perturbation.explanation: By removing the CUSIP number, future references to the CUSIP within internal documentation are rendered ambiguous. While the Issuer is still referenced, the omission creates uncertainty in enforcement if a specific security identifier is needed later.

perturbation.original_text: ARES TRADING SA ARES TRADING SA By: /s/ Cédric Hyde By: /s/ Luigia Bocola Name: Cédric Hyde Name: Luigia Bocola Title: CFO Title: Finance Manager
perturbation.changed_text: ARES TRADING SA By: /s/ Cédric Hyde Name: Cédric Hyde Title: CFO
perturbation.explanation: By removing Luigia Bocola's signature block, the agreement lacks a second signatory for Ares Trading SA. Internal controls documentation may require two signatures for such agreements, creating a contradiction and potentially invalidating the filing. If the documentation or policy exists, the single signature will be an issue.
perturbation.location: Section relating to Ares Trading SA

perturbation.original_text: MERCK KGAA, DARMSTADT, GERMANY MERCK KGAA, DARMSTADT, GERMANY By: /s/ Rando Bruns By: /s/ Tim Nielsen Name: Rando Bruns Name: Tim Nielsen Title: Head of Treasury Title: Head of Capital Markets
perturbation.changed_text: MERCK KGAA, DARMSTADT, GERMANY By: /s/ Rando Bruns Name: Rando Bruns Title: Head of Treasury
perturbation.explanation: Similar to the change with Ares Trading SA, removing Tim Nielsen's signature block for Merck KGaA creates a lack of a second signature. This contradicts potential internal policies requiring dual authorization for legal agreements. There is an implicit instruction for how MERCK KGAA authorizes its documents, so omitting one of them is an issue.
